bibl.title: Memorandum from Henry Rose Carter to [Michael E. Connor], [April, 1923]

div1.p: Carter suggests revision to Connor's paper about the biology of the mosquito vector.

div1.head: Memorandum from Henry Rose Carter to [Michael E. Connor], [April, 1923]

list.head: Memorandum.
list.item: 1) Use Aedes aegypti instead of Aedes Egyptus.

item.p:
2) The “stegomyia” is essentially a day biting mosquito, feed-
ing by preference during the day. Although the greater part of its
biting is done by day, it does feed also at night.
In place of ---“The stegomyia----during the day light hours.”

list.item:
3) I doubt the painlessness of the bite. Depends I suspect
on the immunity of the individual. Would not change this, however.

4) “clear” in place of “clean.” They do not object to bac-
terial contamination.

5) This is meant as an average and hence should stand. I
think the maximum number of eggs recorded (Fielding, An. Trop. Med.
& Parisitology. Vol. 13: P. 259) is 750.

6) Insert the words “for the majority.” between the words
“that” and “it does not extend.” The statement as it stands is
beyond what is proven.
